titleStmt.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Lucile Aly, February 18, 1973
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, John Gneisenau, 1881-1973

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Neihardt, John Gneisenau, 1881-1973
bibl.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Lucile Aly

keywords.term: John G. Neihardt: A Critical Biography
All is but a beginning : youth remembered, 1881-1901
Patterns and Coincidences: A Sequel to All Is But A Beginning

revisionDesc.change: Weakly, Laura K. Added keywords and correspDesc

div1.p:
We have been reading your biography aloud, and I want to tell you how fine we think it is. ("We" means Mr. and Mrs. Young, and Mrs. Elmer Holmes, who has taken on a part of the job of reading to me. Sometimes the Three read by turns.)
17
-2-
Dear Lucile, its such a bully job, and often we remark on how excellent your anaylses are.
How I do hope someone with real vision has the opportunity to read the MS!

I wonder if Dr. Peden is a member of the Press board at Missouri. If so, has he explained my opinion or general
-3-
attitude towards the book? Oh I am so eager for your book to get a fair break! Let me know anything you hear.

This is Sunday. On Tuesday we go to Columbia to meet the sound truck from Hollywood. You have already heard that the United Artists will make
I borrow Myrtle's eyes for my writing on the book!
a record album of my recitations, I'm — ?
I'm making progress on the new book. It is to be composed of high "spots" of my experiences only. There is no continuous 1, 2, 3 narration of events. It will all be rich I hope.
"All is But a Beginning" is at the 4th printing — perhaps the 5th by now. Anyway it is doing well, and all readers who will seem hailing over it.
Do you hear or have you heard of the book.
div1.note: I do want to see you!

div1.ab:
John G. Neihardt
5835 Vine St.
Lincoln, Neb. 68505
U.S.POSTAL SERVICE.NE 683 PM 19 FEB 1973 MORE WILL VE THE MORE Y GIVE HEART
